metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11985 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
IP address spoofing when proxying using mod_remoteip and mod_rewrite For configurations using proxying with mod_remoteip and certain mod_rewrite rules, an attacker could spoof their IP address for logging and PHP scripts. Note this issue was fixed in Apache HTTP Server 2.4.24 but was retrospectively allocated a low severity CVE in 2020.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11985` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> released pre-CVE assignment as an SRU to xenial

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.15').
